property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.bct
pgame.title: 1b: Assess Keyphrases
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with group keyphrases</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This sub-step presents the set of concerns and keyphrases from all users for discussion and agreement over the breadth and depth of concerns and keyphrases.

When the group reaches agreement over the set of concerns and keyphrases, they become the building blocks for the next step, categorizing keyphrases.

Detailed instructions
  1. Explore the group's concerns and keyphrases using the tools provided (sort or filter).
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own, to discuss the breadth and depth of the group's concerns and keyphrases.
  3. Return to "Brainstorm Keyphrases" to edit or add concerns and keyphrases if necessary.
  4. Vote to move forward when satisfied with the group's progress.

property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.cst
pgame.title: 2b: Assess Categories
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with group categories</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This sub-step presents a set of 'group categories' synthesized from the contributions of all users for discussion and agreement.

When the group reaches agreement over the set of group categories, they become the building blocks for the next step, building hierarchies using those categories.

Detailed instructions
  1. Explore the group's group categories using the additional information provided.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own, to discuss the breadth and depth of the group categories.
  3. If the moderator provides announcements, vote your agreement or disagreement.
  4. Vote to move forward when satisfied with the group's progress.

property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.cht
pgame.title: 3b: Assess Hierarchies
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with group hierarchy paths</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This sub-step presents a set of hierarchy paths from the contributions of all users for discussion and agreement.

When the group reaches agreement over the set of hierarchy paths, they become the building blocks for the next step, specifying indicators for hierarchy paths.

Detailed instructions
  1. Explore and vote on the group's hierarchy paths, sorting them based on how many users built them (frequency), number of votes, or alphabetically. Vote counts are updated when users refresh the page.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own, to discuss the breadth and depth of the group's hierarchy paths.
  3. If the moderator provides announcements, vote your agreement or disagreement.
  4. Vote to move forward when satisfied with the group's progress.

property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.vtt
pgame.title: 4b: Assess Indicators
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with group indicators</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This sub-step presents the indicators contributed by all users as well as additional information provided by data analysts for discussion and agreement.

When the group reaches agreement over the appropriate indicator for each hierarchy path, they are included in the final report as the group's suggestion for a mapping and discussion activity in a subsequent workshop.

Detailed instructions
  1. Click on each hierarchy path in the left column to explore the indicators specified for it and make your recommendation. Click "Save" after each recommendation you make.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own to discuss the group's indicators. The ratio in the 'selection' column displays the groups' yes votes on the given indicator in relation to all votes.
  3. If the moderator provides announcements, vote your agreement or disagreement.
  4. Vote to move forward when satisfied with the group's progress.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.vtt.experttool
pgame.title: Data analyst tool
pgame.description: <small>Data analysts review units of measurement for indicators</small>

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.report
pgame.title: 5a Finalize group report
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on the group report</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This step provides a summary of the activity in Steps 1-4 for discussion and agreement.

When the group reaches agreement over the report, this phase of the research comes to an end and the group's chosen indicators are suggested for a mapping and discussion activity in a subsequent workshop.

Detailed instructions
  1. Read the report.
  2. Comment on the report using the form at the bottom of the web page. Comments can be of any nature.
  3. Vote (at the top of the page) whether you agree or disagree to move forward to end the experiment.
